paper_abstract: We investigate quantified interpreted systems, a computationally grounded semantics for a first-order temporal epistemic logic on linear time. We report a completeness result for the monodic fragment of a language that includes LTL modalities as well as distributed and common knowledge. We exemplify possible uses of the formalism by analysing message passing systems, a typical framework for distributed systems, in a first-order setting.
paper_title: First-Order Linear-time Epistemic Logic with Group Knowledge: An Axiomatisation of the Monodic Fragment
